intro: Psychotria chlorocalyx, commonly known as the white-leafed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are typically pale green to white in color. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
